page.title: 13Industry - Hotpoint
page.content: Many of our parents and some of our brothers and sisters work at the Hotpoint factory. Mr. Gamble, our teacher,tried to arrange a visit, but we weren't allowed to go because it was considered too dangerous. Instead Mr. Lavers, a manager from Hotpoint came to visit us. He told us that there were 3 Hotpoint factories in the U.K., and that the factory in Peterborough concentratres on fridges. Almost 2 000 people work there and help to produce the 7 000 fridges made there each week. All the fridges they make they sell straight away and at the moment they cannot make enough. Hotpoint does make other domestic electrical appliances; washing machines, toasters and irons. Hotpoint got its name from the newly invented 'Hot-pointed iron' many years ago, which replaced the square irons.
